metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29980 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Uninitialized memory in a canvas object could have caused an incorrect free() leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.13, Thunderbird < 91, Firefox ESR < 78.13, and Firefox < 91.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29980` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 91.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.13.0+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required
